Posts.Content: RosieMjdtrt wrote: Hello All, After core biopsy of three different spots in left breast (all same quadrant), I was told 2 spots DCIS grade 3 and the other was ALH. I originally wanted to go with bmx but family members talked me out of it. MRI suggested possibility of micro invasion. Again I wanted bmx, but due to lack of support went with lumpectomy. Just got results yesterday... Clear margins, but 8mm invasive tumor found. Just when you think you're done lol. Now I need to go see an oncologist and wait for the onco type for the tumor. I am 45, er and pr positive but don't know about HER2. Is chemo now a possible part of treatment? I know the lx and bmx would not really change the prognosis, but I am totally regretting my decision to go with just the lumpectomy. I just feel like every test comes back with worse news. Dx 3/27/2015, DCIS, Left, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Surgery 5/16/2015 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Dx 5/26/2015, IDC, Left, <1cm, Stage IB, Grade 3, 0/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 8/4/2015 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Not DCIS after all RosieMjdtrt RosieMjdtrt

Posts.Content: May 29, 2015 07:06AM RosieMjdtrt wrote: Thanks. HER2 negative. Onco type will determine chemo. I also wanted a one and done surgery. My BS seems to be so against the bmx, not sure why. She did a phenomenal job with my lx though. I am DD so she had plenty to work with. Linda, I am also 8mm but not triple positive. I am surprised they aren't recommending chemo because of the HER2+. I don't know how the rest of you feel, but even though stage 1 is a really great place to be, this testing and waiting really blows. I have such a hard time concentrating at work because all I wanna do is research and learn.
Posts.Title: Not DCIS after all RosieMjdtrt RosieMjdtrt

Posts.Content: May 28, 2015 08:45AM RosieMjdtrt wrote: Go on vacation!!! I went to Florida 3 days after my original diagnosis of DCIS. The vacation kept me from obsessive cancer thoughts. After my lumpectomy I was told I also have 8mm invasive tumor. So, no longer stage 0 but now Stage1b. Wish I had another vacation planned, because the obsessive thoughts are back and I feel I am back to square one (not knowing treatment plan and now having to go see an oncologist). Hang in there and be prepared for the waiting... It truly seems to be the worst part
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed questions... gooseberry LindaKinNC

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2015 10:36AM RosieMjdtrt wrote: Scared, please don't take this the wrong way, but have you considered seeing someone about your anxiety? When I was diagnosed with early stage and it was determined no chemo was needed (low onco type score), I had no fear. However, my sister is now suffering from a bit of anxiety. Since my paternal grandmother had it in both breasts and now I have it, she just feels it's a given that she has it. She seems to be obsessing over her breasts and my family is very worried about her
Posts.Title: Indentation scared89 keepwalking

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2015 10:18PM RosieMjdtrt wrote: don't know why my stats don't show. Original diagnosis was dcis grade three. After lumpectomy changed to idc grade 3
Posts.Title: Really Want to Forgo Rads RosieMjdtrt ruthbru

Posts.Content: RosieMjdtrt wrote: Although I am still waiting on my onco score, I am faced with having rads as part of my treatment. I originally wanted to go with the bmx but family thought I was being too aggressive. My original diagnosis was DCIS grade 3 but after my lx the pathologist found 8mm invasive tumor. I know my prognosis is excellent so I am not worried there, however, I know radiation really messes up your breast tissue which messes up chances of future reconstruction and also poses other long term issues. My BS did a fantastic job and is really pushing the rads over bmx. Also, with the slight chance of having to add chemo to the mix, will radiation still be required? I am stage 1 grade 3 with DCIS grade 3 and at 45 know there is still plenty of time for a recurrence. I have no problem removing both breasts! Anyone else have similar thouhgts or concerns? Dx 3/27/2015, DCIS, Left, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Surgery 5/16/2015 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Dx 5/26/2015, IDC, Left, <1cm, Stage IB, Grade 3, 0/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 8/4/2015 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2015 11:48PM RosieMjdtrt wrote: Thanks debiann. I see you started with lex but later got mx. Was this due to margins, change in diagnosis, personal choice? Hope I'm not prying it's just that from the get go my gut decision was bmx and I have regreted changing to lx since my surgery.
